newsitem.title: SPAIN: Spain okays Endesa bid for Fecsa, Sevillana.
newsitem.headline: Spain okays Endesa bid for Fecsa, Sevillana.

text.p: The Spanish stock market commission CMNV has fully authorised electricity firm Endesa's bid for up to 75 percent of Fecsa and Sevillana, Industry Minister Josep Pique told journalists on Wednesday.
By acquiring the regional utilities Endesa will be able to more equally balance its production and distribution of electricity, Pique said.
"The consolidation of Endesa, Fecsa and Sevillana will end the imbalance between generation and distribution which Endesa has at this moment," Pique said.
With the formation of the new group, Endesa will produce 50 percent of the nation's electricity and distribute 40 percent, up from current levels of 35 and 15 percent respectively.
The new electric group will see Endesa rank fourth in European electricity generation and fifth in distribution.
Pique also confirmed the government plans to sell its 67 percent stake in Endesa's capital in public share offerings between 1997 and 1999.
